name: La Samanna by Orient-Express

reviews.text: La Samanna is the arguably the premier hotel in St Maarten (actually St Martin, as it’s in the French part). The location beside and slightly above a faultless and picturesque sandy beach is certainly one of the most attractive on the island, if not THE most attractive.
reviews.title: Idyllic and Exclusive until Conventions Arrive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The whole development, which includes the main hotel buildings, its attached bungalows and the La Samanna Villas, is located in isolation at the end of a long drive past a security barrier. You will be in secure seclusion at La Samanna. There isn’t even a sign to it from the main road!
reviews.title: Elegant newly renovated retreat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the hotel the view is fantastic; all the rooms I saw were excellent; the main pool is a lovely deep, large pool with excellent pure water for swimming. It all looks picture postcard perfect and mostly it is.
reviews.title: Tucked away, relaxing, unique

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dining Options are varied, with two semi-outdoor restaurants, one usually serving buffet style, the other fine dining, and finally the bar with its lighter menu. The breakfasts provide a well-appointed buffet with a good deal of choice. Service generally good but can be a little slow at times.
reviews.title: totally unimpressed

reviews.text: I began to think that this hotel was pretty near perfect, until the convention arrived. I immediately thought: Lucky salespeople to be taken to place of this quality for their annual bash. Then I started to think: Poor rest of us guests, having to suffer this lot.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: As a former Protocol official, I am quite familiar with the importance of combining highly professional service with exceptional attention to detail. La Samanna meets these high standards and then exceeds them. From the moment I arrived at the private, security- attended front gate to this magnificent property, until my checkout, it was an exceptional stay!
reviews.title: "Extraordinary Stay"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is nestled in lush surroundings on the French side in one of the most exclusive areas of St. Maarten. The property is simply breathtaking, from the unbelievably beautiful and immaculate white sand beach with excellent and attentive food and beverage service, to the tennis courts and full service spa, you are not wanting for anything.
reviews.title: La Perfect Trip!

reviews.text: I stayed in an ocean front suite with a patio that led directly to the beach only a few steps away. The suite was large, well appointed,with state-of-the-art amenities, a full kitchen, large screen flat-TVs and a very comfortable king-size bed. The marble bathroom had an ultra-modern, open shower with an overhead showerhead that was wonderful to use. The tub was large and comfortable and there is twice a day maid service; although if you ever needed anything, staff was there at a moment’s notice.
reviews.title: Fabulous & Luxurious

reviews.text: Due to renovations to the reception area and main restaurant, food was served by the pool. But even this substitute arrangement was in a beautiful setting, looking straight out to ocean, canopied by white tenting with open sides and a cool mist system blowing gently and periodically to keep you cool on the hottest of days.
reviews.title: Elegant, Peaceful, Great Service and Beautiful Smiles Everywhere!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food is delicious whether it is breakfast, lunch or dinner. I wish they had a grilled chicken breast dinner which conforms to my strict diet, but there were sufficient menu items to satisfy any palette. I strongly recommend the lobster which I was greedy enough to eat twice. The wine list is superb.
reviews.title: Elegant and Peaceful

reviews.text: I took my family (wife and two girls 12 and 14). We stayed in a two bedroom suite on the beach. It was more like a villa with kitchen and living room, two bathrooms as well which worked out great as my daughters had their own space. Views from the room were right out to the ocean. We had our own private patio as well and within 20 feet were on the beach on our own beach chairs. Great set-up especially if you needed to go back to room for something. The beach steward would bring you towels and an insulated bag with iced water bottles (a nice feature). The rooms were recently refurbished and they did an excellent job redecorating, clean, simple and calm - no crazy tropical bedspreads (whites and blues and colorful artwork).
reviews.title: Great vacation... will come back

reviews.text: Breakfasts were awesome, really good coffee, waffles and fresh fruit...lots to choose from and great view from seating are outside. Lunch selections at the beach restaurant were very good but it can get expensive. Dinner options are few. Main restaurant is where breakfast is served...food is great but choices are limited and a family f four without a bottle of wine runs $300. We tried room service one night (their weakest link as food quality is average) and went into town for dinner for more casual and less expensive option.
reviews.title: Bliss

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beach is beautiful and secluded from other resorts and water was very clear with good snorkeling right off the beach. Great water sports ... kayak, wave runners, sea bobs (a lot of fun if you never tried one). Also have a trampoline out in the water (you have to swim to get to it).
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.text: We went in June and it was low season so we felt we had the whole resort to ourselves. Maybe it was half full. Parents note that some guests are topless if that sort of thing bothers you.
reviews.title: Great time for my family

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In the afternoon they would come around with fresh fruit or beignets for guests on the beach. Nice touch. Everyone was very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Paradise name? Samanna

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Escape the frenetic Marigot to this French resort with a formal sense of luxury in a Caribbean setting. While the rooms are variable depending on what you book, you get what you pay for. Some of the beach villas that cost less and are closer to the beach haven not been redone whereas others are well appointed and decorated in a more modern style. We have also stayed in the main lodge, and this feels a bit far from the beach but closer to the pool if you prefer this scene. We prefer the beach, and usually stay in the villas one the second floor with a private deck, better views, and a greater sense of privacy. This is truly a romantic getaway, and a lovely spot with a perfect Carribean beach.
reviews.title: Carribean elegance at is best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My Fiancé and I stayed at La Samanna on our trip to st Martin and I must say on behave of him and I our stay was AMAZING! Between the beautiful hotel and the amazing staff we truly felt at home! We made so many friends at La Samanna and they were so sweet truly down to there soul! So I will end this with not a good-bye but with we will definitely be seeing you again next year for our WEDDING! And again thank you for excepting us with open Arms you are definitely missed! <3
reviews.title: Amazing vacation!

reviews.text: My wife and two teenage daughters spent a week in La Samanna in mid June of this year (2012) and this place delivered a holiday and vacation experience of a lifetime! I, too, had a very difficult time convincing my daughters to leave - they wanted another week! La Samanna delivered on multiple fronts and rarely (if ever) disappointed. From the courteous and informative airport shuttle driver, to the personable/helpful front desk/reception team, the knowledgeable concierge staff, friendly restaurant team, to an experienced and guest-first water sports team, and a very attentive beach service staff, La Samanna is a five star hotel/resort in every way possible. Previous Trip Advisory reviews complained of less than desirable service at La Samanna - this was not our experience at all. Exec team member Maylis and front desk staffer Isabel's welcoming smile, lovely demeanor, and desire to make every aspect of our trip magical was heartwarming. Concierges Monica and Roberta went out of their way to find our lost bags at the Julian International Airport and have them delivered to our room (one of our flight connections was delayed and our bags didn't make it). Julian and Boy in the Sports Shack introduced jet skiing to my daughters and truly helped make my girls' beach experience the best ever! We enjoyed our two bedroom suite (15 steps from the beach) so much! Beautifully appointed, recently renovated, and perfectly air conditioned, it was sometimes difficult to leave! We did explore other restaurants on the French side of St. Martin (we loved Le Cigale), but our food quality and presentation at La Samanna was excellent. We rented a car at the resort (so convenient) for a few days to explore the French side of the island (the heavily developed and overly commercialized and touristy Dutch side was not our cup of tea) and especially enjoyed the adventure course/ziplining experience at Loterie Park. We can't wait to return - hats off to GM Pascal Deyrolle for delivering a simply heavenly experience!
reviews.title: Simply Heavenly!

reviews.text: We visited for my sister's 50th bday and it was an incredible experience from beginning to end - we had never been to St. Martin - loved the island, the hotel and the staff were exceptional - she still cannot stop talking about it and we are returning next year - this is a place where you will return to for years to come.
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.text: This was by far the most delightful vacation we have had in recent memory. It was our 25th wedding anniversary and we took along our grown up daughter. She is quite discerning and she didn't want to come back! Right from our welcome drink and sandwich to our last breakfast, the service was good, the hospitality gracious and the smiles genuine. We enjoyed the beach and loved the beach service even more. The drinks were just right. The waters here are a remarkable crystaline blue.The water sports guys got us snorkelling and jet skiing, firsts for us. It was a lot of fun.
reviews.title: Unforgettable

aka: La Samanna By Orient-Express Hotel St. Maarten/St. Martin
description: La Samanna nestles amongst lush gardens overlooking 55 acres of spectacular beachfront. A complete resort in itself, La Samanna offers a spectacular private beach, two poolside terraces, 83 luxurious rooms and suites and 8 newly completed 4600sq. ft. villas with private pools. Enjoy its sophisticated food offerings and award winning wine cellar, indulge in its European Elysees Spa, or simply enjoy the privacy and relaxation of this sophisticated and sensual French-Caribbean enclave. La Samanna is everything you could wish for in a Caribbean hideaway.
